Andy Coulson denies being aware of any wrongdoing at the paper, part of Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp media group, and police said last month there was not enough evidence to charge him with any crime. Obviously when he was editor of the News of the World, bad things happened at that newspaper and when he found about those, he resigned. That was the right thing to do, David Cameron told BBC Radio 4's Today programme. "I gave him a second chance," David Cameron added. "I think he has done a good job for the government and for the country.

A year after the war, Saddam mocked George H. W. Bush from Baghdad and claimed victory:` It was George H. W. Bush with his own will who decided to stop the fighting. Nobody had asked him to do so.' , taking over day-to-day operations as CEO as of April 4. The company said the goal of the surprise executive change, the biggest at the Web firm since Eric Schmidt joined it as CEO in 2001, is to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Co-founder Sergey Brin will focus on strategic projects, in particular new products, one of his key passions, as he said on a conference calls.
